alert.note: Alert for Butler; Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 3:52PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON, EASTERN BUTLER AND SOUTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 351 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Wetherington. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Forest Park, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton, Franklin, Springdale, South Middletown, West Chester, Sixteen Mile Stand, Olde West Chester, Four Bridges, Highpoint, Hunter and Wetherington. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 18 and 23. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 17 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
